name: batter wheat mix production | wheat flour mix | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/19728/documentation

This activity represents the production of wheat mix for batter to produce fish sticks, also named fish fingers. The wheat is then grinded at a milling plant in  to produce wheat flour. The flour is then freighted by truck to an ingredient and food additiove processing plant. The composition of the final wheat mix produced is: a) 80% wheat flour arriving from the mill i; b) less than 10% wheat starch ; c) less than 10% salt; d) less than 5% sunflower oil; e) pH regulators ; and f) less than 1% vitamins A and C. Kraft paper is used for packaging.

Provision of raw materials, transport to mill and activities at the mill, including use of energy.

The transport from the mill to the fish stick processing factory are not included.
category: C:Manufacturing/10:Manufacture of food products/106:Manufacture of grain mill products, starches and starch products/1061:Manufacture of grain mill products

processDocumentation.timeDescription: Data are from 2011 and were reported by the company per 1 metric ton of final product.
processDocumentation.geographyDescription: The wheat processing factory is located in NW Spain, but is representative of the state of the art in Europe.The system modelled consists of the production of wheat in the Ukraine, which is then sent to the port of Santander (Spain) by marine freight. The wheat is then grinded at a milling plant in Palencia, in Castile and Leon) to produce wheat flour. The flour is then freighted by truck to an ingredient and food additiove processing plant in the province of Pontevedra (Galicia, Spain). The composition of the final wheat mix produced is: a) 80% wheat flour arriving from the mill in Palencia (Spain); b) less than 10% wheat starch arriving from The Netherlands; c) less than 10% salt arriving from Alicante (Spain); d) less than 5% sunflower oil from Jaén (Spain); e) pH regulators from France; and f) less than 1% vitamins A and C arriving from China or Switzerland.
processDocumentation.technologyDescription: The technology corresponds with the current available techniques for processing wheat.
processDocumentation.dataTreatmentDescription: This dataset can be used for battering of a wide range of food products.
processDocumentation.samplingDescription: No sampling was undergone. The data were directly provided by company technical staff.
